kernel_beta.reasoning: Both conditions are pure comparisons with no side effects and do not modify shared variables. i and j are computed once before the checks and not changed between them. Coalescing preserves short-circuit behavior (j <= i is only evaluated when i < n) and removes an unnecessary nesting level, improving readability without altering semantics.

kernel_product.reasoning: Both checks are independent and side-effect free. The inner condition does not modify variables used by the outer. Using a single if with logical AND preserves the original control flow due to short-circuiting and simplifies the code by eliminating one nesting level.
